bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Dr. Alison Bernstein worked at the Ford Foundation from 1983 until 2010, with a break in the early 1990s to assume the position of Associate Dean of the Faculty at Princeton University.

Bernstein started as a program officer in 1983, and she was named director of Education and Culture at the Foundation in 1992. Bernstein was later promoted to vice president of the Ford Foundation's Education, Creativity and Free Expression Program, later called called Creativity and Free Expression. In 2011, Bernstein left the Foundation to become the director of the Institute for Women's Leadership at Rutgers University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains Alison Bernstein's correspondence with grantees and colleagues at the Ford Foundation that she responded to as a program officer in the Foundation's Education and Culture program area.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into one series: Correspondence, 1987 April-1990 February. Individual folders are organized alphabetically or reverse chronologically.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Individual folders arranged in reverse chronological order
